faqs.question: What is the MN Taco Bell 25K?
faqs.answer: The MN Taco Bell 25K is a unique running event that combines the thrill of racing with the fun of Taco Bell. We offer three distance options (5K, 15K, and 25K) with different 'spice levels' to match your running experience.

faqs.question: What are the different race formats?
faqs.answer: We offer three 'spice levels': Mild (5K Fun Run) for beginners and families, Hot (15K Challenge) for regular runners, and Diablo (25K Ultra) for serious athletes. Each includes different Taco Bell experiences and swag!

faqs.question: When is the registration deadline?
faqs.answer: You can register up until race day! However, we offer early bird pricing until April 1st and regular pricing until May 15th. Late registration is available but costs more.

faqs.question: What's included in my registration?
faqs.answer: All participants receive a race bib, timing chip, commemorative t-shirt, post-race Taco Bell meal voucher, finisher medal, and race photos. 25K participants get additional premium swag and nutrition packages.

faqs.question: Are there age requirements?
faqs.answer: 5K Fun Run: All ages welcome with parent/guardian supervision for minors. 15K Challenge: Must be 12+. 25K Ultra: Must be 16+. All minors need parent/guardian waiver signature.

faqs.question: When can I pick up my race packet?
faqs.answer: Packet pickup is available Friday evening (4-7 PM) at a pre-race location, or race morning starting at 6 AM at the main tent. We recommend Friday pickup to avoid race-day lines!

faqs.question: How challenging is the course?
faqs.answer: The 5K is flat and family-friendly. The 15K includes some gentle hills. The 25K features varied terrain including hills and trails, designed to challenge experienced runners while showcasing beautiful Minnesota scenery.

faqs.question: What happens if there's bad weather?
faqs.answer: The race happens rain or shine! In case of severe weather (lightning, dangerous conditions), we may delay or modify the event. Participants will be notified via email and social media of any changes.

faqs.question: Can family and friends come to watch?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Spectators are welcome and encouraged. We'll have designated viewing areas, and the finish line festival is open to everyone. No admission fee for spectators.

faqs.question: Is parking available?
faqs.answer: Yes! Free parking is available in adjacent lots. We also encourage carpooling, public transit, or biking to the venue. Alternative parking options are available for busy race days.

faqs.question: How will my time be recorded?
faqs.answer: All participants receive timing chips with their race bibs. Results will be posted online within 2 hours of the race finish and emailed to all participants. Professional race photos will be available for download.

faqs.question: I have dietary restrictions. Can I still participate?
faqs.answer: Yes! While Taco Bell food is a big part of our event, we can accommodate most dietary needs. Please contact us before race day to discuss your specific requirements and alternative options.

faqs.question: What should I bring on race day?
faqs.answer: Bring your confirmation email, valid ID, and arrive dressed to run! We'll provide everything else. Optional: water bottle, sunscreen, and layers for changing weather. Bag drop is available.

faqs.question: Can I volunteer instead of running?
faqs.answer: We'd love your help! Volunteers receive a t-shirt, food, and our eternal gratitude. Contact us at the email below to learn about volunteer opportunities and sign up.

faqs.question: What's your refund and transfer policy?
faqs.answer: No refunds after May 1st. Deferrals to the following year are available until May 15th with a $10 processing fee. Race bibs are not transferable between participants for safety and insurance reasons.

contact.responseTime: We typically respond to emails within 24-48 hours.
